intro: Strepsanthera, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, lantern-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce capsules as fruit. Strepsanthera species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and South America. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique and striking floral displays.
